answer.jahia:value:
“Measuring the audience of a website (also called web analytics) enables you to quantify the use of a site by taking into account factors such as the number of individual visitors, pages viewed, as well as the number of visits and their average duration. It brings together the measurement, collection, analysis and presentation of data from the internet, which is then used to help understand and optimize the use of the web.”

© Copyright Wikipedia authors – this article is available at CC BY-SA 3.0

The analysis of internet traffic at EPFL can be performed free of charge by using Google Analytics. Currently, Google Analytics Anonymization is the only tracking tool approved by EPFL. If you want to use other tracking tools, please contact the VPSI.

GA can be used for:

  • Your Jahia web site

  • Your News Channel

  • Your Memento

In all three cases, the tool is not installed by default – the local webmaster must do it. A Google Analytics account is required to use it.


Note: By using Google Analytics, you accept its General Conditions. This authorizes Google and its partners to use, host, store, copy and modify the analyzed data.

question.jahia:value: Legal obligations linked to the use of Google Analytics

answer.jahia:value: Note: The law on the protection of personal data (LPrD Art.13) obliges the acquirer to inform the person concerned of all collection of data relevant to him/her. Therefore, it is necessary on the one hand to anonymize the script provided by Google, and on the other to notify the cybernauts using the procedure below.

1. Go to www.google.com/analytics.
  2. Create an account for your site by following the instructions.
  3. Note the identifier (ID) linked to this account: for example UA-12345678-1.

question.jahia:value: For non-Jahia sites: anonymizing the script provided by Google

answer.jahia:value:
To anonymize the IP in Analytics, you have to perform the following steps:

  1. Add the anonymization command ga('set', 'anonymizeIp', true); insert the command between the “create” command and the “send” command;
  2. Replace the domain name “epfl.ch” by “auto”, so that Google Analytics correctly manages the sub-domains ga('create', 'UA-XXXXXXX-Y', 'auto');
  3. You should then have a script similar to the example below:

ga('create', 'UA-XXXXXXX-Y', 'auto'); ga('set', 'anonymizeIp', true);

ga('send', 'pageview');

Note: For those who are still using the (very) old Google script ga.js, we strongly recommend that you upgrade to analytics.js (see the documentation below); otherwise, you have to add the command:

_gaq.push (['_gat._anonymizeIp']); before the command: _gaq.push(['_trackPageview']);

assuming that the variable _gaq contains the parameters for ga.js.

For more information, see Google’s official documentation:

https://developers.google.com/analytics/devguides/collection/analyticsjs/ip-anonymization

question.jahia:value: For non-Jahia sites: add a warning message on the sites

answer.jahia:value:
Since 29 August, the warning message is installed in the following libraries:

  • www.epfl.ch/css/epfl.css

  • www.epfl.ch/js/globalnav.js

  • www.epfl.ch/js/globalnav-noanalytics.js

If your site includes the .css file, as well as one of the javascript files mentioned above, it should be displayed automatically.

If it is not included in your site, you will have to add the following two libraries containing only the functionality of the warning message:

  • www.epfl.ch/css/epfl-cookie-consent.css

  • www.epfl.ch/js/epfl-cookie-consent.js

The solution uses a cookie on the epfl.ch domain, so that the displaying of the message is not repeated. This cookie has a life-span of 365 days.

• How do I share the management and consulting of statistics?

    A Google Analytics account is managed by the person who requested it. It is therefore this person’s responsibility to allow or deny access to the account. Neither EPFL (nor our team) offers support for Google products, cannot know to whom an account belongs, and can neither allow nor deny access.

    • How do I modify or delete an account?

    If an account already exists on your channel, and you wish to delete or replace it, please make your request to our hotline. Note that we cannot retrieve deleted accounts, nor determine who manages an existing account.

     

    • Can I have several Google Analytics accounts on the same site?

    No. It is preferable to have only one account per site, and correctly anonymized.

    • How can I ensure that my site is well referenced?

    As a general rule, you should follow Google’s recommendations as published on their good-practice page. Using the internal EPFL research engine, a simple exercise is to perform a test on the chosen search (word). If your site is poorly ranked, contact the webmaster for the page that appears in first position and ask him to add a link to your information from his or her page.

text.jahia:value: Please read the french version of this website. The content is not translated, except for 'Analytics use' page.
